data.title: Picnic Areas • Jekyll Island, Georgia • Vacation, Conservation, and Education Destination
data.meta_description: Located throughout the island, our picnic areas provide the perfect spot for a quick lunch.
data.meta_site_name: Jekyll Island, Georgia • Vacation, Conservation, and Education Destination
data.text:
Located throughout the island, our picnic areas provide the perfect spot for a quick lunch.

Oceanview Beach Park

Situated mid-island, Oceanview Beach Park offers stunning views of the Atlantic Ocean and quick access to the sand. The park reopened in May 2019 after extensive renovations, which include an ADA-accessible beach access point with a balcony-style overlook and shower facilities, along with four family and two group pavilions equipped with picnic tables and grills. The ample parking area features seven electric vehicle charging stations.

Corsair Beach Park

Corsair Beach Park, located between the Jekyll Ocean Club and Days Inn hotels, serves as the southern boundary for the Jekyll Beach Village. This park includes an ADA accessible bathhouse with restrooms and changing areas, two picnic pavilions, outdoor showers, enhanced landscaping, and 123 additional public parking spaces for the area.

-

Great Dunes Beach Park

St. Andrews Beach Park

South Dunes Beach Park

Clam Creek

Located at the north end of Jekyll Island, adjacent to the fishing pier and Driftwood Beach, Clam Creek has a picturesque view of the Sidney Lanier Bridge and evening sunsets.

This park features several picnic tables, grills, a fishing pier, fishing shop, restroom facilities, and beach access.

More Picnicking Ideas

Bringing ready-to-eat food from home? Enjoy these other picnic-friendly spots:

Under a shady Live Oak in the Historic District

Along the Jekyll River for incredible sunset views

On a blanket at one of our 7 beach areas

For the safety of our wildlife, please remember to take everything with you when you leave.
